case_name: Mehrzad Zarei v. Association of Families of Flight PS752 Victims
legal_issues: Oppression remedy under the Canada Not-for-Profit Corporations Act
outcome_details: The application for an oppression remedy was dismissed. The court found that the Association's Board decisions adhered to the business judgment rule, and Mehrzad's reasonable expectations were not violated.
decision_factors: Failure to demonstrate oppression or unfair prejudice
Adherence to procedures under the Canada Not-for-Profit Corporations Act
cited_cases: Watto v. Immigration Consultants of Canada Regulatory Council, 2019 ONSC 701
Peoples Department Stores Inc. (Trustee of) v. Wise, 2004 SCC 68
Hadjor v. Homes First Security, 2010 ONSC 1589
Campaign for the Inclusion of People who are Deaf and Hard of Hearing v. Canadian Hearing Society, 2018 ONSC 5445
Saskatchewan WFT Taekwondo et al v. Taikwondo Canada, 2015 ONSC 2937
summary: Mehrzad Zarei's application for an oppression remedy against the Association was dismissed. The court found that the Association's actions were reasonable under the business judgment rule and did not violate Mehrzad's reasonable expectations.
